column4: azzytee - actually i don't think the & at the end is gonna help - when you close the terminal it will still die - screen perhaps

understood, didn't know if you knew about it or not. :)
nvidia-settinsg is a graphical application.. use gksudo instead.
tt that is correct -- don't use "sudo" for gui apps - my bad "gksu" saves 2 letters as well (for the lazy, which all good unix/linux admins should be)
the !startup factoid need to be updated for 10.04 me thinks.
agreed.
i'd just use linux-image (the bug report will include the version info)
which is what i have done. i am reviewing the report and it states 'Package - linux-image *not installed*  .. this is the reason i'm asking.
in that case i guess you need the actual version...
happen to know what lm stands for?  That's a cool test if it works.

this is what i used to reference lm.. it doesn't give a definition but gives a location where you can find flag identifiers. http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-general-1/proc-cpuinfo-flag-lm-358563/
thanks
possibly lm stands for long mode
thanks!
you peaked my interest and made me dig farther. thank you.
;) - that a really handy test for the "does my cpu support 64" i must say - i'm certainly stealing your command.
